content.body: i hope they continue
makes our life hella easier

Hixie, indeed.  It strikes me as odd when spammers copy content that references my name (a reasonably unique search term) into their spam blogs, not realizing that I'm likely to find and kill their spam blogs minutes after they post (since I work at Technorati).
Oh what a little research would do to the world of spammers.
Rather, what a little research on spammers part would have on them not being so easily found out.
Rather, what a little research by average users would have done on making spam less profitable :)
chuckles.
Too true.
I'd use my surname as a URL but it would be hard for people to remember.
there's a small number of people who actually like spam and use it
and that's all it takes for it to be profitable
I'm still hunting for a decent domain name.
I suppose I'm too much of a perfectionist though and the quest will continue forever on.
Hi

I'm finding spammers are actually getting creative and posting comments that are somewhat relevant to the post.  If it wasn't for their sites clearly being commercial and not related to web dev, it'd be hard to tell
Hixie, FWIW, I am getting your twitters
tantek: yeah, i just don't get anyone else's.
is there a way to see who has added you as a friend?
the "27 Followers" line in my profile isn't a link
http://twitter.com/Hixie/with_friends shows them
ah thanks
you sure you're logged in? the followers link is active for me whenI am
definitely logged in
and that page doesn't show a list of followers
just the Friends
fwiw, I see links for favorites & friends, but not followers
oh hey
i see a link to Followers when i go to the Favorites page
man this site is so flaky
on a page listing news, would one use one <article> to wrap all news and then an <article> for each news item, or would one use a <section> to wrap all news then an <article> for each news item?
http://simon.html5.org/temp/w3c-home-in-html5.html
zcorpan_: cool!
styling doesn't work very well in firefox :(
hsivonen: running it through your validator seems to reveal some bugs
The header element must have exactly one h1â€“h6 descendant.
yeah, that's a bug
I thought I had fixed it already
also it complains about <nav><a> and <footer><address>
zcorpan_: perhaps the content model of <nav> has changed
looks
I guess I might as well do the header/footer refactoring over easter
that should fix the address bug
Zero or more block-level elements, or inline-level content (but not both).
zcorpan_: I am rather convinced that it was block only when I worked on that part
ok
zcorpan, nice
zcorpan, maybe make an XHTML5 one for the styling?
http://simon.html5.org/temp/valid-html5.png lol!
yeah, that was fun even though in general I don't like validity badges
i don't like them either :)
annevk: i'd rather mozilla fixed their html parser
fair enough
Hixie: what's the deal with "one or more block-level elements" in the content model of <details>? usually you have zero or more
fantasai's framework assumes that you always have zero or more, so I have a schema-wide refactoring ahead if you really meant one or more
wonders what the use of zero would be
in that case
annevk: making placeholders conforming
although the refactoring would be good to schema aesthetics anyway
realizes that zero block level elements counts as inline level empty string
there is a concept of inline level empty string?
zcorpan: I meant in terms of deriving the document tree from the grammar
ok
zcorpan: but the empty string counts as inline-level content
not a spec concept, though

So

contains a single empty string textnode, while

contains a single element, which in turn contains a single empty string textnode?
Dashiva: they do not contain text nodes in the DOM sense
So document tree != the final DOM?
Dashiva: but as far as the spec's notion of inline content and the RELAX NG notion of text is concerned, yes
why does tbody take One or more tr elements, instead of 0 or more? http://www.whatwg.org/demos/repeat-01/ has an empty tbody if you click Remove
zcorpan: excellent question
will bug the list
should perhaps apply to <tr>s as direct children to table too

i've seen hixie say that wml content generally isn't well-formed xml, and wml parsers aren't drocanian xml parsers
but i can't find it back
zcorpan_: ok. Downliad Opera 4 and test it :)
